alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew; Brown; Johnson; Monroe; Morgan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 1:42AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Monroe, southeastern Morgan, southwestern Johnson, Brown and northwestern Bartholomew Counties through 215 AM EST... At 141 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Bloomington, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Monroe, southeastern Morgan, southwestern Johnson, Brown and northwestern Bartholomew Counties, including the following locations... Mahalasville, Peoga, Indiana University, Morgantown, Trafalgar, Helmsburg, Lake Lemon, Beanblossom, Gnaw Bone and Yellowwood Lake. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 93 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
